instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2330 - couple time a week, show weird colour on internal display.
threads.message:
showing on external monitor is fine. only happen on internal display couple time a week..
i've tried two good known working display and same result.

it seems pure white colour has changed to blue.


ASD EFi and OS passed all graphic tests.


what do i need to check? LVDS Transmitter Termination problem  ?

[IMG]http://i64.tinypic.com/23vahbl.jpg[/IMG]
[IMG]http://i65.tinypic.com/nv8a2r.jpg[/IMG]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2330 - couple time a week, show weird colour on internal display.
threads.message: Could be LCD cable or the MUX (u9600). Press on U9600 and see if the problem goes away. Either reflow u9600 or reball.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2330 - couple time a week, show weird colour on internal display.
threads.message: it seems to be the lcd cable. just tried a bare lcd screen and it is working fine. so know working screen has bad cable.   problem solved.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2330 - couple time a week, show weird colour on internal display.
threads.message: Just make sure to poke at U9600 and see if it does not happen again. A bad LCD connector can also cause this, so check again before ripping the assembly apart.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2330 - couple time a week, show weird colour on internal display.
threads.message: solved duke. just a bad cable.
